page.title: 16FARMING IN N.WEST NEWBURY
page.content: {FARMING}Typically,arable.Sheep reared for mutton & lamb and cattle for beef. Meat sold to major chains.Some timber sold. {TYPICAL FARM:CASTLE FARM}in centre of area situated on chalk on higher land overlooking Kennet valley on north side.500 acres worth Â£2,000 per acre. In l985,398 acres used for arable:203 acres wheat,150 acres hay/silage,45 acres barley.Owner + 3 full-time workers manage farm. {FARM MACHINERY}includes 3 tractors,1 combine harvester,ploughs etc. Farm bisected by footpath,well used by local people & tourists visiting Donnington Castle.Little damage experieced. {FISH FARMING}Farm sited at{Bagnor} where fresh clean water drawn from boreholes.Trout reared from eggs.Sold when fish reach 7.5cm.in length.
